CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper November 25, 1950, pg. 1, reads: "King and Queen - Garfield Washington [Whittington] and Gloria Puryear, seniors, have been selected by varsity lettermen as 'King' and 'Queen' of the football season at Rochester High School.  He's a guard on his school's team. His mates [illegible] ...grand fellow.' Both will be crowned this week. - Harris Photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1950, pg. 2, reads: "Coronation Highlight - Rochester High School varsity football letterman recently elected Ray Whittington and Gloria Puryear, 'King and Queen of Football' for the year. The regal honorees were crowned in appropriate ceremonies at the annual football dance held not long ago at the school. The 'King' and 'Queen' and their 'court' are, left to right, Eugene Matecook, Catherine Ferrara, attendant; Miss Puryear, Whittington, also a guard on this years team: Theresa Halahan, attendant, and Kenneth Heckle. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Garfield Whittington wearing no. 32 football jersey, and Gloria Puryear, standing at drinking fountain, with picture of Abraham Lincoln above, in Rochester High School
